Type.ThreadSafetyStatement: Gtk# is thread aware, but not thread safe; See the <link location="node:gtk-sharp/programming/threads">Gtk# Thread Programming</link> for details.

MemberSignature.Value: public virtual void BeginCatchBlock (Type exceptionType);
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance void BeginCatchBlock(class System.Type exceptionType) cil managed

Docs.param: The exception to be caught by the following code.
Docs.summary: Starts a handler for a particular exception.
Docs.remarks: Any exceptions thrown in between the call to of a type derived from the will be handled by the code following this point in the generated IL stream.

Docs.summary: Marks the beginning of a try block

remarks.para: Use this method to flag the beginning of a try block. See "Exception Handling" on the ECMA documentation Partition II for details on exception handling.

public virtual System.Reflection.Emit.Label DefineLabel ();
.method public hidebysig newslot virtual instance valuetype System.Reflection.Emit.Label DefineLabel() cil managed

Docs.summary: Defines a new label, that can be used as a branch target.
Docs.remarks: This method only tells the that the given label exists, and that it can be used as a branch target by branch instructions. It doesn't tell the where the actual branch target is though, which is done using the method, This two step approach allows you to jump to code that hasn't been emitted yet.

Docs.param: A pointer to the document writer (can be null).
Docs.summary: Associates the IL position with a specific line of code on the source code line.

remarks.para: This method is called to produce debugging information.
The block defined by the start/end line and columns is associated with the code starting at the current position.
